poem:
Suspensions in England

The roar of restless youth—  
Their voices clipped,  
Ejected from classrooms  
For a breath of defiance.

Subdue the wild  
With strokes of dispossession,  
But what gardens will bloom  
In fields abandoned?

In halls once filled  
With learning's promise,  
Suspended dreams  
Collect like dust.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Friday briefing: What’s behind the rapid rise of school suspensions in England? Good morning. School suspensions have been steadily rising since 2015, but in the last few years there has been a particularly sharp increase in the suspension and exclusion rate in England and it is getting worse. Using the most recent data available, the Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR) has found that up to the Easter holidays 2024 there was a 20% rise". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
